Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate people trying to communicate over a long distance.
The student can design and draw a device that uses string to connect two distant students, representing the communication tool.
The student can incorporate elements that show the device using sound to communicate, such as waves or vibrations.
The student can label the specific parts of the device that are necessary for it to work (e.g., cups, strings).
The student can use only the materials provided and label them in their drawing.
The student can depict whether the device effectively allows communication over the distance by illustrating sound waves traveling along the string.
The student can provide a brief explanation, along with the drawing, of how their design allows communication over a distance.
